    • Method Detail

      • getDistance

        public abstract double getDistance(java.lang.Object o1,
                 java.lang.Object o2)
        Calculates and returns the distance between two objects. Please note that the distance function has to be symmetric and must obey the triangle inequality. This method is the same as getDistance(Object, Object, int, double[], double[]) with a k=0.
        Parameters:
        o1 - Object 1 to compute
        o2 - Object 2 to compute
        Returns:
        the distance as float from [0, infinite) or -1 if objects distance cannot be computed

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance(java.lang.Object o1,
                 java.lang.Object o2,
                 int k,
                 double[] x1,
                 double[] x2)
        Calculates and returns the distance between two objects. Please note that the distance function has to be symmetric and must obey the triangle inequality. distance in k is: d[k+1](o1,o2)^2 = d[k](o1,o2)^2 - (x1[k]-x2[k])^2 .
        Parameters:
        o1 - Object 1 to compute
        o2 - Object 2 to compute
        k - defines the dimension of current fastmap operation
        x1 - is needed when k > 0 (see documentation above), all x1[l] with l < k have to be present.
        x2 - is needed when k > 0 (see documentation above), all x2[l] with l < k have to be present.
        Returns:
        the distance as float from [0, infinite) or -1 if objects distance cannot be computes
